name: CernerCapabilityStatement
title: Cerner Capability Statement
description: Cerner implementation of FHIR on top of Millennium

implementation.description: Cerner implementation of FHIR on top of Millennium

rest.documentation: Cerner implementation of FHIR on top of Millennium

extension.valueUri: Replace this with mock URL for test

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: A single or comma separated list of Account ids. It is a required field if the -guarantor or patient fields are not given.

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: The entity that caused the expenses. It is a required field if the _id or -guarantor fields are not given. Must be set with identifier.

searchParam.name: -guarantor
searchParam.documentation: The entity that responsible for payment. It is a required field if the _id or patient fields are not given.

searchParam.name: type
searchParam.documentation: The identifier for the account. Required in every search request.

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: Statement Account number. Must be set with patients

searchParam.name: _count
searchParam.documentation: The maximum number of results to return in a page. Not honored when '_id' is set.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: A single or comma separated list of AllergyIntolerance ids. It is a required field if the patient field is not given.

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: Who the sensitivity is for. It is a required field if the _id field is not given.

searchParam.name: clinical-status
searchParam.documentation: Certainty of the allergy or intolerance.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: A single or comma separated list of Appointment ids. Either the '_id' parameter or one of the 'patient', 'practitioner' or 'location' parameters must be set.

searchParam.name: _count
searchParam.documentation: The maximum number of results to return in a page. Not honored when '_id' is set.

searchParam.name: date
searchParam.documentation: A date or date range from which to find appointments. This must be set when using patient, practitioner or location. The 'date' parameter may be provided once without a prefix or time component to imply a date range or once without a prefix and with a time component to search for appointments at a specific time. Alternately it may be provided twice with 'le' and 'gt' prefixes to search for appointments within a specific range. The date prefix pair must create a closed range.

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: One of the individuals of the appointment is this patient. Either the '_id' parameter or one of the 'patient', 'practitioner' or 'location' parameters must be set.

searchParam.name: practitioner
searchParam.documentation: One of the individuals of the appointment is this practitioner. Either the '_id' parameter or one of the 'patient', 'practitioner' or 'location' parameters must be set.

searchParam.name: location
searchParam.documentation: This location is listed in the participants of the appointment. Either the '_id' parameter or one of the 'patient', 'practitioner' or 'location' parameters must be set.

searchParam.name: status
searchParam.documentation: The overall status of the appointment.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: A single or comma separated list of CarePlan ids.

searchParam.name: date
searchParam.documentation: A date range with which to find CarePlans. If used, the ‘date’ parameter must be provided twice. Once with a 'ge' prefix representing the earliest date, and once with a 'le’ prefix representing the latest date. The date prefix pair must create a closed range.

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: Who the careplan is for. It is a required field if the _id field is not given.

searchParam.name: category
searchParam.documentation: The category of the careplan. Category assess-plan is supported as of now.

searchParam.name: _count
searchParam.documentation: The maximum number of results to return. Not honored when '_id' is set.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: A single or comma separated list of Condition ids. It is a required field if the patient or subject fields are not given.

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: Who has the condition. It is a required field if the subject or _id fields are not given.

searchParam.name: subject
searchParam.documentation: Who has the condition. It is a required field if the patient or _id fields are not given.

searchParam.name: clinical-status
searchParam.documentation: The clinical status of the condition.

searchParam.name: category
searchParam.documentation: The category of the condition. Categories problem-list-item and encounter-diagnosis are supported as of now.

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: Retrieve coverages for a patient.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: A single or comma separated list of Device ids. It is a required field if the patient field is not given.

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: The patient to whom Device is affixed. It is a required field if the _id field is not given.

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: The patient the document is about. It is a required field if the subject field is not given.

searchParam.name: subject
searchParam.documentation: The subject the document is about. Must be a Patient. It is a required field if the patient field is not given.

searchParam.name: encounter
searchParam.documentation: The Encounter in which the document was created.

searchParam.name: period
searchParam.documentation: A date range with which to find Documents. If used, the 'period' parameter must be provided twice. Once with a 'ge' prefix representing the earliest date, and once with a 'lt' prefix representing the latest date. The period prefix pair must create a closed range and cannot be equal to each other.

searchParam.name: _count
searchParam.documentation: The maximum number of results to return in a page.

searchParam.name: type
searchParam.documentation: The kind of document (LOINC if possible).

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: A single or comma separated list of Encounter ids. It is a required field if the patient or subject fields are not given.

searchParam.name: _count
searchParam.documentation: The maximum number of results to return in a page. Not honored when '_id' is set.

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: The patient present at the encounter. It is a required field if the _id or subject fields are not given.

searchParam.name: subject
searchParam.documentation: The patient present at the encounter. It is a required field if the _id or patient fields are not given.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: A single or comma separated list of Immunization ids. It is a required field if the patient field is not given.

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: The patient for the vaccination record. It is a required field if the _id field is not given.

searchParam.name: date
searchParam.documentation: Vaccination (non)-Administration Date.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: A single or comma separated list of MedicationRequest ids.

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: The patient to return MedicationRequests for. It is a required field if the _id field is not given.

searchParam.name: intent
searchParam.documentation: The intent of the MedicationRequest.

searchParam.name: status
searchParam.documentation: The status of the MedicationRequest.

searchParam.name: _lastUpdated
searchParam.documentation: When the resource version last changed.

searchParam.name: -timing-boundsPeriod
searchParam.documentation: The date-time within the period the medication should be given to the patient. Must be prefixed by 'ge'.

searchParam.name: _count
searchParam.documentation: The maximum number of results to return in a page. Not honored when '_id' is set.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: A single or comma separated list of NutritionOrder ids.

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: The patient to return NutritionOrders for. It is a required field if the _id field is not given.

searchParam.name: status
searchParam.documentation: The status of the NutritionOrder.

searchParam.name: _lastUpdated
searchParam.documentation: When the resource version last changed.

searchParam.name: _count
searchParam.documentation: The maximum number of results to return in a page. Not honored when '_id' is set.

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: The patient the observation is about. It is a required field if the subject field is not given.

searchParam.name: subject
searchParam.documentation: The patient subject the observation is about. It is a required field if the patient field is not given.

searchParam.name: category
searchParam.documentation: A single or comma separated list of classifications of the type of observation.

searchParam.name: code
searchParam.documentation: A single or comma separated list of observation types.

searchParam.name: date
searchParam.documentation: A date or date range from which to find observations. The 'date' parameter may be provided once without a prefix or time component to imply a date range or once without a prefix and with a time component to search for observations at a specific time. Alternately it may be provided twice with 'le', 'lt', 'ge', or 'gt' prefixes to search for observations within a specific range. The date and prefix pairs must create a closed range.

searchParam.name: _lastUpdated
searchParam.documentation: A date or date range used to search for observations which were last updated in that period. The '_lastUpdated' parameter may be provided once without a prefix or time component to imply a date range or once without a prefix and with a time component to search for observations at a specific time. Alternately it may be provided twice with 'le', 'lt', 'ge', or 'gt' prefixes to search for observations within a specific range. The date and prefix pairs must create a closed range.

searchParam.name: _count
searchParam.documentation: The maximum number of results to return in a page.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: A single or comma separated list of Organization ids. It is a required field if the identifier field is not given

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: The Organization's Identifier. It is a required field if the _id field is not given

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: A single or comma separated list of Patient ids. Either the '_id' parameter, or a combination of 'identifier', 'birthdate', 'name', 'given', 'family', 'address-postalcode', 'phone', or 'email' parameters must be provided.

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: A patient identifier. Either the '_id' parameter, or a combination of 'identifier', 'birthdate', 'name', 'given', 'family', 'address-postalcode', 'phone', or 'email' parameters must be provided.

searchParam.name: name
searchParam.documentation: The beginning of any name of the patient. Either the '_id' parameter, or a combination of 'identifier', 'birthdate', 'name', 'given', 'family', 'address-postalcode', 'phone', or 'email' parameters must be provided.

searchParam.name: given
searchParam.documentation: The beginning of the given name of the patient. Either the '_id' parameter, or a combination of 'identifier', 'birthdate', 'name', 'given', 'family', 'address-postalcode', 'phone', or 'email' parameters must be provided.

searchParam.name: family
searchParam.documentation: The beginning of the family name of the patient. Either the '_id' parameter, or a combination of 'identifier', 'birthdate', 'name', 'given', 'family', 'address-postalcode', 'phone', or 'email' parameters must be provided.

searchParam.name: address-postalcode
searchParam.documentation: The postal code of the address of the patient. Either the '_id' parameter, or a combination of 'identifier', 'birthdate', 'name', 'given', 'family', 'address-postalcode', 'phone', or 'email' parameters must be provided.

searchParam.name: birthdate
searchParam.documentation: The date of birth of the patient. Either the '_id' parameter, or a combination of 'identifier', 'birthdate', 'name', 'given', 'family', 'address-postalcode', 'phone', or 'email' parameters must be provided.

searchParam.name: phone
searchParam.documentation: The value of the phone number of the patient. Either the '_id' parameter, or a combination of 'identifier', 'birthdate', 'name', 'given', 'family', 'address-postalcode', 'phone', or 'email' parameters must be provided.

searchParam.name: email
searchParam.documentation: The value of the email address of the patient. Either the '_id' parameter, or a combination of 'identifier', 'birthdate', 'name', 'given', 'family', 'address-postalcode', 'phone', or 'email' parameters must be provided.

searchParam.name: gender
searchParam.documentation: The administrative gender of the patient. Gender may only be provided if another parameter other than '_id' is provided

searchParam.name: _count
searchParam.documentation: The maximum number of results to return in a page. Not honored when '_id' or 'identifier' are set.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: A single or comma separated list of Person ids. It is a required field if the identifier field is not given

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: A person's Identifier. It is a required field if the _id field is not given

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: A single or comma separated list of Practitioner ids. It is a required field if the identifier field is not given

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: A practitioner's Identifier. It is a required field if the _id field is not given

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: A single or comma separated list of Procedure ids. It is a required field if the patient or subject fields are not given

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: Search by subject - a patient. It is a required field if the _id or subject fields are not given

searchParam.name: subject
searchParam.documentation: Search by subject. It is a required field if the _id or patient fields are not given

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: A single or comma separated list of RelatedPerson ids. It is a required field if the identifier or patient fields are not given.

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: An Identifier of the RelatedPerson. It is a required field if the id or patient fields are not given

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: The patient this related person is related to. It is a required field if the id or identifier fields are not given

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: A single or comma separated list of ServiceRequest ids.

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: The patient to return ServiceRequests for. It is a required field if the subject or _id fields are not given.

searchParam.name: subject
searchParam.documentation: Individual or Entity the service is ordered for. It is a required field if the patient or _id fields are not given.

searchParam.name: code
searchParam.documentation: What is being requested/ordered.

searchParam.name: _lastUpdated
searchParam.documentation: When the resource version last changed.

searchParam.name: _count
searchParam.documentation: The maximum number of results to return in a page. Not honored when '_id' is set.
